hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: The National Gallery what is aciphex Travel has been part of his working life since the days when work was still play. He won his first prize, at the age of 15 in 1972, for a painting of an allotment in Provence. His first solo exhibition, 12 years later, was of pictures painted in Jamaica. Since then, in a career in which his illustrations have appeared on everything from book covers and postage stamps to stage sets, he has been rattling around the world with a drawing board under his arm. Hence the name of his retrospective show at the Chris Beetles Gallery in London, which opens next Tuesday – Paul Cox: A Journey Through His Art.
